title: Environment modules in a shared spack install root doesn't choose the _sp_module_prefix well
body:
I installed multiple arch versions in a spack install_root and I saw that the environment-modules loading with a spack built environment-modules package doesn't work right because --print-shell-vars uses an unqualified spec search and doesn't necessarily choose a good  _sp_module_prefix:

```
spack --print-shell-vars sh,modules
_sp_sys_type='linux-fedora29-x86_64'
_sp_tcl_root='/opt/spack/share/spack/modules'
_sp_lmod_root='/opt/spack/share/spack/lmod'
_sp_dotkit_root='/opt/spack/share/spack/dotkit'
_sp_module_prefix='/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos6-x86_64/gcc-4.4.7/environment-modules-4.2.2-h7lzl3yy5ouwpj6t2naat67xyzaw7yo5'
```
I added `arch=spack.architecture.sys_type()` to be more selective:

```
diff --git a/lib/spack/spack/main.py b/lib/spack/spack/main.py
index a5b0358..df8f00a 100644
--- a/lib/spack/spack/main.py
+++ b/lib/spack/spack/main.py
@@ -584,7 +584,7 @@ def print_setup_info(*info):
     # print environment module system if available. This can be expensive
     # on clusters, so skip it if not needed.
     if 'modules' in info:
-        specs = spack.store.db.query('environment-modules')
+        specs = spack.store.db.query('environment-modules arch=%s' % spack.architecture.sys_type())
         if specs:
             shell_set('_sp_module_prefix', specs[-1].prefix)
         else:
```
```
spack --print-shell-vars sh,modules
_sp_sys_type='linux-fedora29-x86_64'
_sp_tcl_root='/opt/spack/share/spack/modules'
_sp_lmod_root='/opt/spack/share/spack/lmod'
_sp_dotkit_root='/opt/spack/share/spack/dotkit'
_sp_module_prefix='/opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora29-x86_64/gcc-8.3.1/environment-modules-4.2.2-ha5kdfgbtekleizqdtzsffd3z2lyizgy'
```
